Events that occurred on 10 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1936 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 8b.
1943 - Actor Peter McKenzie is born.
1952 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Moira Sayer.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Carole Ward.
1966 - Voice actor André Sogliuzzo is born.
1981 - Mythcon 12 at Mills College in Oakland, California.
1984 - Mythcon 15 at Mills College in Oakland, California.
1986 - Mythcon 17 at California State University in Long Beach.
1997 - Mythcon 28 at Pepperdine University in Malibu, California.
2005 - The Tolkien Society Guide to Oxford is published.
2005 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony plays in Herodion, Greece.
2007 - Omentielva Tatya - 2nd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Antwerp, Belgium.
2013 - Omentielva Lempea - 5th International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Helsinki, Finland.
2014 - Mythcon 45 in Wheaton College, Massachusetts.
2017 - Omentielva Otsea - the Seventh International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages at California State University, East Bay.
2021 - Tolkien Calendar 2022 is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral of King Théoden[1] is held outside the walls of Edoras. Faramir and Éowyn are betrothed.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
